pages.text: Trains are the ultimate way to transport large amounts of items, fluids, or people long distances. They are also $(l:kinetic_machines/contraptions)Contraptions$(), so you can attach contraption components to them.

The first thing you'll need to even begin with trains is Train Tracks. Tracks are created in a $(bold)Recipe Sequence$() from one of the types of Sleepers (stone slabs) and either Iron or Zinc nuggets. You will need a lot of these if you plan to have your train any amount of distance, so it'd be best to automate the production of them. $(ponder)
Next is the Train Casing. This is created by applying a Sturdy Sheet to a Brass Casing. Sturdy Sheets also require a Recipe Sequence. Using the Train Casing, you can create a Train Station.
After placing a Train Station next to a track, $(ponder)
In order for the train to move, you will need to place Train Controls on it. $(ponder)
If you want the train to move without you controlling it, craft a Schedule. It can be given to creatures on $(l:construction/seat)Seats$() to make them the conductor. $(ponder)
